The specials are all based on fresh food. Which makes the sea food specials amazingly fresh, and you can taste it. The vegetables are fresh farm raise and a real good side.   My family and I try to go at least two times a week.

I confess, the only reason my boyfriend & I tried the place was the coupon for a free appetizer.  The place had only been only open a few weeks so we decided we'd go gawk & giggle.  We made reservations but were seated immediately (kudos to the hostess!).   The main annoyance I noticed was the noise level.  The decor is charming & sophisticated but the acoustics are atrocious and not conducive to an intimate dining experience. On the other hand, the food was awesome.  Granted, we chose a fairly white-trash fare: mac & cheese and sweet potatoe fries as sides, but it was still amazingly tasty.  We ordered the lobster rolls as our appetizer (gotta get the most out of that coupon!).  I enjoyed lovely chicken sandwich, my guy had a thick, juicy burger.   overall, delightful.  We might even go back sans coupon!!  :-)

I was really excited to try this place since I am a French food fan. The food was hit or miss, I unfortunately ordered the misses. My dad ordered the filet mignon and really liked it. My mom also really liked the French onion soup. I did not like the ahi starter the fish just wasn't fresh enough. I also had the foie gras torchon witch was underwhelming with minimal weird sauce and toast. I tried the potatoes author gratin that was enjoyable. I just was hoping for a better experience. The people were really nice but the other tables around us were having issues with the food being incorrect and there were flies on the inside restaurant so overall not great atmosphere.

After a rough day visiting family in a hospital my father and brothers had dinner here on 5/3/17.  Our server was Jason who seemed very pleasant.  Dinner was delicious - food was excellent quality, except one steak was not warm but we weren't going to let that get to us.  However, At the end of the meal, Jason mentioned that due to our rough day he would like to give us a complimentary piece of cake. Wow! Thanks Jason!    Today we are back at the hospital and read the receipt and the martini's which were a fair price EXCEPT we were charged $1.50 for ICE for each drink!  Are you kidding me?  Maybe in San Francisco where we are having a drought!!  The ice in the water was free - umm was it different?

We came here for lunch.  They open at noon, not 11am, just FYI!  There were people waiting outside so when they opened, there was sort of a rush for the waiters to get everybody seated and drink orders established.  Here's what we ordered:  Fritto Misto - Calamari, delish; julienne carrots, scrumptious; ginger, meh but it wasn't them - I'm just not a big fan of ginger.  Tempura style fried.  Tasted like tempura and not over-fried food.  Yay  Vogue Burger - YUM ... I don't usually have fancy gourmet burgers.  In fact, this is probably the fanciest gourmet burger I've ever had and it was quite good.  There was something sweet in there - maybe the chutney - and the bun was sooo good.  A whole lot of different flavors but nothing overpowering.  Nice blend.  Chicken Panini - the husband had this and he enjoyed it.  I took a bite of his and thought it was pretty good.    Sweet tomato fries - YUM.  I thought the flavoring on it is one of the better ones I've had compared to other places  Vogue Mac N Cheese - Got this for our 14 mo old.  It's "fancy mac n cheese" so needless to say, she wasn't too thrilled with it.  I liked it ... kind of had a strong cheese flavor to it but not the traditional cheddar cheese you normally put in there.  The service was good.  The general atmosphere was also nice.  Definitely a good place to try!

Oh Vogue!  Went for my 3rd visit and still undeniably awesome!!!  Not only is the food AMAZING, the service is fantastic!  I have sampled several apps, sides, entrees and daily specials.  Seafood, from the oysters to the swordfish=phenomenal!  I will continue to go back to Vogue for any special occasion.  It is pricey, be prepared, but completely worth every cent.  Don't forget to tip your servers & bartenders :)

I'll keep this simple; I've worked in restaurants before as a chef. It was painfully obvious that the kitchen staff was overwhelmed by Valentine's Day customers and as such the food production quality has fallen precipitously. Many dishes arrived at our table cold and tough, sending back the plates required explaining, slowly what was wrong with the dish. The bottle of wine I was served had corked and thus turned to vinegar, and was later told "that's just how it tastes" My best friend is in the wine industry and I have learned what corked wine tastes like.   The steak i had ordered was covered in a gravy of unidentifiable origin, i had asked for the steak to be rare and it was both unevenly cooked and definetly medium well and when i asked for Dijon mustard (a staple at any fine French restaurant) was given a small cup of whole grain mustard, which i asked about and was told many time was Dijon mustard (it's not if you know anything about food).   The last straw was really when i went to give my aunt the rose from the little water carafe as a Valentine's send off and our entire party was chased into the parking lot for stealing a place setting, mind you this was a Valentine's Day dinner.   In conclusion: now that chef Aurore de Beauduy has left the restaurant the quality has, as these thing go, taken a nosedive. Chef "mike" (microwave) needs to know that reheating food is never the way to impress anyone under 90 years old which it would seem is the crowd this restaurant attracts.
The burgers are amazing and the other food does not disappoint!  Always looking forward to the latest Chef's special!

I made reservations approximately 4 or 5 days before my husband's 65th birthday on Tuesday.  I spoke with a female who took my reservation for 3 for lunch at 12:30.  We arrived at the Vogue Bistro only to find they are not open for lunch on Tuesdays during the summer!!!  Left a detailed voice mail hoping to at least get a return call.  That was over 24 hours ago.  Obviously, customer service isn't a top priority for this establishment. One star is being generous.

Came here for dinner & had the chicken. It was supposed to have a crispy outside, but it was soggy.  It was tender and had a nice taste, as did the veggies that came with it.  Ordered the butternut squash and some bread too.  Both were good!  I'm giving 4 stars because I don't think the price is justified for the food.  Service was good and the bathrooms were clean too.  May or may not come back... depending on happy hour/coupons to be enticed.

Back again after a few years.  Menu hasn't changed much in 3 years. All food still solidly prepared.  Wine list has expanded some -which was welcomed.  We were seated in the bar area, which unfortunately feels decided bar-like, rather than restaurant like.  it also has a giant screen TV - which I personally don't think any decent restaurant should have - but that's my opinion.    Anyway - we once again enjoyed basic bistro fare at reasonable prices and expect to back again.   Although I'm out every winter, I am surprised I haven't been back here in 3 years since 2012.  It's definitely a gem of the Surprise area.  Everyone I know from 8 - 80's enjoys this place.

We got food poisoning, the appetizer was burned & food took over an hour to arrive. The risotto was bland and full of heavy cream. The waiter was very pleasant & the martini was great. The kitchen & food just need improvement.
Reminded me of my favorite restaurant in NY. Service was great, the owner checked in on us several times. Martinis were excellent. It is definitely pricey but worth it!

This place is wonderful. Great food and great staff! Everyone is friendly and attentive. The food is excellent. I have eaten here several times and would recommend this restaurant to anyone. It is a bit on the pricey side but you definitely get what you pay at for. Sometimes we sit at the bar and eat and the bartender is very nice and knows what she's doing. The only thing I don't get is the tv - there is a tv at the bar and the last time I went here (in May) they were playing the movie Elf...in MAY - and there's no sound so if you don't know what is playing you wouldn't be able to watch it... they really need to go back to subtitled French movies - after all it IS a French restaurant and that did add a nice touch to the ambiance...

It's a great looking place; kind of like a trendy nightclub (except filled only with disgruntled, old, rich snobs). I only say that because during the 40 minutes (no joke) I waited for my food, I was seated at a table that was less than two feet away from an elderly couple- that proceeded to whine and complain about every single facet of this restaurant. They hated the food, the prices, and the excruciating wait times (rightfully so).  This place has great potential for a romantic environment to take your loved ones to, BUT do not expect privacy. Everyone is seated within a few feet of each other.  The staff is great. Bubbling with excitement, and striking conversations that they obviously don't care about. Completely fake, but very nice. THE FOOD: I got Duck Confit ($20)... Very delicious! Totally worth the wait. It came with a couple potato cuts on the side- also delicious!! I did have to go get some dinner later because I was still hungry.  DESSERT: I ordered the CrémBrulet- AMAZING!!! The waitress took it off the bill, because my food took so long. Very co

I bought the Groupon offered earlier this year.  It is a very nice restaurant, a bit crowded inside.  I'm not sure the price warrants the food.  I think even with the coupon we still spent over $60 for two people with beer and one mixed drink.  Waitress wasn't very attentive especially after the meal was delivered.  I will probably go again but it won't be a weekly thing.  My husband and I eat out about 3 times a week so Vogue Bistro would be a twice a year thing maybe.

'Man up' boys and remember what Mommy [should have] taught you. LADIES FIRST. Although the staff was attentive to our table of 6, why did they first serve him the same entree I ordered? They filled the guys water glasses and emptied the pitcher before filling the ladies. Food was fine. Onion soup and 'lasagna in the bowl' were very good. Cioppino was as expected. Almost everything had a twist; Bruschetta was really thick and warm and lacked fresh toppings, the 'fresh bread' was either toasted or dry, lasagna and eggplant were in bowls, calamari looked like a giant fried onion. I probably won't go back.
Was here a few years back for Mother's Day.  The salad was splendid arrange of mixed green and fruit, absolutely delicious!!  My main course was Lobster risotto, amazing. I need to go back!

This is one of my favorite places to bring friends here in Surprise. We recently had visItors and we brought them right when Vogue Bistro opened and we were able to get a table outside.   The Bloody Mary was delicious our friend said, and the chicken panini they ordered really hit their palette nicely. Our waitress was super friendly and on top of making sure our drinks were filled.   All in all our friends got to experience what we always experience. Good food, and great service!   If you arrive right when they open sitting is not a problem, but if you want a Friday night date night I recommend to reserve your table.

We went there on a Monday night for my birthday.  I made a reservation online for 6:30 p.m. around mid-day.  I received confirmation of the reservation while we were 10 minutes away from the Bistro!  Good thing.  I had gone there for lunch with a friend in the spring, really liked it, and was looking forward to a special occasion meal.  It was special, but not in the way I hoped.  We were seated right away (on the patio) and brought menus.  Soon after being seated, the busboy brought us water and the waitress got our drink order.  After we sat there twiddling our thumbs, the busboy asked if anybody had checked on us and we said no.  Pretty soon, the waitress came by and we ordered our appetizers.  Everything was "after awhile."  We waited at least 30 minutes between the appetizer and the entree.  When our waitress saw me looking over at the kitchen, she said "your order will be coming up."  It was about 10 more minutes.  A long time lapsed after we had finished eating before she came back to check on us.  I asked if I could order dessert, and she "confided" in me that my husband had gone up (an hour earlier) to order a dessert for me.  After another while, I asked if it was coming soon, because we were getting tired of waiting.  She said, "They are working on it."  Really?? How long does it take!  We were going to ask to just get the dessert to go when she finally brought it.  Now that part was nice -it was a (complimentary) creme brulee with yummy homemade chocolates.  We arrived at 6:30 p.m., and left at 8:48!!!!!  As for the food, we ordered the stuffed mushrooms, which were quite good.  My husband ordered the roast chicken plate, which was so salty he had to send it back and ordered the meatloaf instead.  The meatloaf was yummy, as were the potatoes au gratin.  I ordered the special, mussels over linguine in a curry(?) sauce.  Still trying to pinpoint the curry.  The mussels and linguine were good, but the sauce was just okay.  As we were leaving, my husband spoke to the manager and told him how bad the service was and how long it took to get our food.  He said nobody had "EVER" complained before.    We will try it one more time.

We eat at Vogue about once a month. The food is always very good and they are more than willing to substitute things. Tonight the service was not great and it was not busy at all. Our ice tea and lemonade ran out about half way through the meal and didn't get offered a refill. Also we didn't get appetizers so sat and waited for our meal without being offered bread like the next table over. We had to request it. When you pay high prices for a meal you should get top notch service!   Last time we went there without a reservation we were willing to sit outside where there were at least 8 tables sitting empty but were told they were full and could not be seated for another hour and a half.   This kind of business will not last long as people remember and neighborhood restaurants depend on repeat customers.
Yummy!  Food was outstanding, and staff was exceptional. I'm glad we tried this place.

We came here because we had a Restaurant.com certificate. It was lunch and about half the tables were full. We had to wait over a half hour for our food. Other tables that seated after us got their food before us. My husband had the Vogue Buger and ask for medium and it came well; no pink in site. I had the Chicken Pannini which had a great flavor but the chicken was thin; mostly a veggie sandwich. The prices were high. $11 for a burger that didn't even come with fries. It took quite a long time to get the bill and then process payment. The certificate made it worth the visit but not sure if would return without the discount.

Horrible. If I could give them negative stars I would . They managed to ruin our thankgsiving meal. Brought out food before drinks, which we waited 20 minutes for . Soggy, overly salted turkey . Nasty rhubarb cobbler desert, barely cooked. Told me they didnt have carmel drizzle to put on my kids ice cream until i pointed out that my carmel apple martini had carmel in it. rude attitudes of waitstaff and management. Will never ever ever step foot in this place again if its the last restaurant on the planet .

This review is about the wine pairing dinners. The menu is always wonderfully matched with a perfect wine but for almost $60 the food is ice cold. We've been attending many of these dinner and use to enjoy them but the last two dinners the food was so cold we hardly touched it. We will continue to eat here but skip the wine dinners.

I went recently with my husband and we really loved it. We had a reservation for 7:45 and we're seated about 8, but that was okay with me. I had the steak vogue, medium cooked, and it was really good. My husband had the duck, which he enjoyed but it was his first time having duck. He loved the Brussels sprouts it came with and I tasted one - they were very very good. I had a peach martini that was excellent and my husband had some kind of tea and whiskey drink that was super sweet but still really yummy. The only complaint I have is I wish they brought out their complimentary bread and butter before the entrees, because being a cook to order restaurant it does take a bit longer for the food and if you are having a few drinks on an empty stomach you get pretty woozy. Even if you aren't drinking, waiting while you are so hungry isn't fun (something we call "hangry" in our family usually occurs). Otherwise we loved this place. I wish we had the money to go more often... but we will definitely reserve this place for special occasions.

If I could give this place 0 stars I would.  Everything from the food to the service was lacking.  I ordered the Waldorf salad with salmon. The salmon was decent but the salad was plain, and dry. I would have probably been able to get more dressing, to liven it up a little if our waitress would have checked on us even once.  I am a server. I have been for 8 years. I am understand and patience, I understand being busy. But come on... Our wine took 10 minutes to arrive to the table and our food took atleast 20-25min... And not once were we checked on.  My date and I each finished our first glass of wine before we were done eating but were never asked if we would like another glass.  The reason people go out to eat is to get served, to have someone wait on them... And our waitress was a disgrace.  We were planning on having an evening out together, lots of drinks, dessert, and good food.  My dates steak was good, small and expensive, the Mac and cheese was dry.  I will never return to this place nor recommend it to anyone.

We come here often and have great service each time! The drinks are amazing. The food has always been top notch. They have great happy hour specials as well and I often get seconds on drinks and food. Great atmosphere! We love sitting outside with our large group, often for birthdays!
Excellent dinner! Yummy dessert! Nice atmosphere! Lemon drop Martini was very good. Entrees are substantial.
I love this place! Their food is amazing and the atmosphere is extremely relaxed! Martinis are just amazing!

My first review of Vogue bistro was removed, so I will keep this one simple and to the point.  The patio seats were too small for a regular size adult. The server had to read the specials from a cheat sheet. The calamari is mostly fried carrots in a nest like structure and is not good. The server did not know what an IPA was nor did they have any. What beers they did have, are served in the bottle with a warm glass. The server did not pour. My steak was cold and my wife's salmon was undercooked. Unfortunately, there is still no fine dining in Surprise. Sorry owner - no reason to have this one removed.

We went here for Christmas dinner. We had called to make reservations but the hostess refused to seat us. She kept telling us that they were booked. Finally, the hostess looked at us and said they would not serve us. We will not be returning here, which is a shame because we have never eaten there and have heard decent reviews. Maybe is the restaurant hires staff that don't have their heads up their butts, we will try it out.

First of all, I was sceptic about a "French" restaurant in Surprise of all places. But I misunderstood, it is 'French " techniques used to cook. We took our son there for his 27th birthday hoping he'd get to experience French food. The place is very small and it was warm in there, I was sweating.  We ordered the French onion soup, a different presentation, phyllo dough crust covered the soup which was a nice touch. The soup was tasty but salty.  The escargot was ok, too salty and a bit dry. The peach bruschetta was beautiful but too sweet. The stuffed mushroom caps had a crab meat mixture filling, very fishy taste and again salty. I had wine that tasted a bit vinegary, like it was old. The beet salad was another beautiful dish but again sweet. My husband had the roasted chicken, it wasn't anything exciting. Our son had the duck, which I didn't taste but he ate it all and said it was fine. I must admit, there were no dishes we ordered that I couldn't make, and better.  The service was great, Jason did an exceptional job. A nice touch was that our son had a choice of a complimentary dessert for his birthday.  Would I return?...... No.

Never again!!   (Actually, no stars) Last night we went to Vogue Bistro with our friends who live in Surprise, otherwise this would not have been our choice. I won't mention the disaster the other meals were last night, just mine. I thought I'd play it safe with a meatloaf advertised as "handcrafted with Black Angus". The menu description made it sound wonderful!  I mean, how could I possibly go wrong with meatloaf? Our waiter suggested a side of seared scallops with our entrees and since I LOVE scallops, I added that to my order. When my food arrived I was shocked to see my meatloaf slice had a very thick, very burnt crust on all 4 sides. The cut surfaces were grilled brown, I'm guessing, to reheat it. The red wine sauce poured over it didn't help - it was quite bitter and only served to hide the surface of the meat. I thought, ok, I'll just eat the inside. The supposed "Black Angus" meat tasted like just filler and had the consistency of the same, not like meat at all. As overcooked as the outside was, one would think the interior would hold together on a fork. No way. Plus it was absolutely flavorless! My picture (if I can find how to post it)  shows the inedible crust and what I left on the plate. On the upside, the auGratin potatoes were delicious as were the scallops! However, while chewing on the scallops, there were pieces of shell(?) I never noticed until I was part way through chewing .... kind of like thin eggshells. My friend experienced the same with hers.  They charged $19 for the meatloaf and $10 for the added scallops. The scallops and potatoes were the only things worth eating on that plate.  Never, ever again!!!

Very interesting place, great atmosphere, good food and nice location, its the kind of place you would normally find in the Scottsdale Quarter or Cave Creek but on the west side.    Originally I wondered about paying the price for a place that wasn't in a 'better' location; but now i have been there i decided its nice not to have made the big trip and parking hassles of those more exclusive areas.   The meal was thoroughly worth the effort.   We got there about 730pm on a Friday and it was busy but not fully packed.   Ordered Fois Gras, escargot and the smoked salmon, then ordered the lasagna and salmon for main course.    Staff were quick, prompt and friendly.  Good service.   Ambiance is really nice.

Went there twice in the last week. Both times were very good. I poke round online a little to just have general knowledge. I THINK I discovered that Vogue Bistro is for sale. I may be mistaking. If it is, this could be good or bad. I guess time will tell.

The West Valley's best kept secret. Beautiful space with the design of a metropolitan restaurant. Great service and very accommodating. I highly recommend the Frito Misto as a starter for a unique tasty experience! Our food was very good and it was a fun dining experience. The location is a little hard to find, but it is exactly what Surprise needs! I definitely recommend it!

I wanted to wait to write a review until after the second time I dined at Vogue Bistro.   Both times I sat outside in the evening but next time I would prefer to sit inside. The only problem I had sitting outside is that it was very dim and hard to see with the minimal lighting. The constant flashes of lights from cars coming into the plaza bothered me as well.   Starting off with the menu they have quite the variety of options.  First with the drinks.  I enjoy fruity alcoholic drinks so I would suggest The Escada Martini. They had a great wine list as well as beer and mixed drink options.   For appetizers I would suggest the stuffed mushrooms, the cheese plate or the beef skewers.   For the entree I suggest the filet mignon. It was perfectly cooked and came in a tasty wine sauce. I have also tried the Alaskan salmon. The portion size was perfect and the salmon also came in an amazing champagne cream sauce. I had a taste of the roasted chicken and it was so moist and perfectly seasoned.   Don't pass up the sweet potato fries the dipping sauce is to die for! Also don't forget dessert. The have a chocolate assortment that is very good!   Overall I would come back if I was in the area.

While the wait was pretty long, the food was delicious.  My husband had the rabbit stew and I had the eggplant parm.  They offer a few choices for kids' meals, decently priced as well.  We spent WAY more than a typical meal for the 4 of us, but it was nice to treat ourselves.

I was invited to a birthday dinner for a veteran over 90. Jennifer, the general manager, LIED when she said there was no reservation. She gave us three different stories. This restaurant can't handle parties of more than 6 is the truth. She turned us away. The booking had been made several weeks in advance and re-confirmed that morning.

Just a quick update on this one.  I'm dropping them down to a 3-star.  Visited a few more times and I feel that it has lost the excitement.  The menu rarely changes, the specials are extremely expensive, and I know that all food is made to order, but it is still very slow.

Not good quality food. Seems like it was bought pre packaged, however the waiter was excellent. I would not eat here again way overpriced for the quality of the food. We had the steak with scalloped potatoes and something that appeared to be broccoli. Appetizer  calamari and scallops was oily and not presented well.

My wife and I live in the neighborhood and would eat and drink at the Vogue quite regularly. The drinks are amazing, as well as be bartender. I believe the only reason I will be revisiting the Vogue is because of the bartender, her martinis are very well done. The Oyster Rockefeller was once my favorite appetizer there; baked just right, perfectly cheesy with not too much spinach dressing... I don't understand what went wrong these last few times we visited. Could it be because the change of restaurant ownership?, Because the Oyster's were completely different... mounds of spinach filler and no Oyster, I literally had to get up and visit the restroom so I could pick the spinach out of my teeth. The hamburgers were once the BEST in the West, but have now become mediocre at best. I have heard rumors that the original owner's opened up a restaurant somewhere in the city. If anyone has information on where this restaurant is located I would really appreciate knowing.   Overall: The restaurant has changed, the food is not as great as it used to be. The drinks are still fantastic and I would highly recommend any of the martini's or bourbon drinks, the entrées not so much.

We had a great experience here celebrating our parents 40th anniversary. They have packages you can have preset up for special occasions and we had a nice table setup with flowers which is a very nice touch. Everything was delicious, our server was very attentive and we felt very welcome by the whole staff. My parents live in the area and will definitely be back!

I would recommend this restaurant if you are in the area and looking for something worth your hard earned cash.  The food was excellent , service was well above average and the ambience is perfect. They have a really ice selection of wine and seem to specialize in Martinis although they also have beer and other liquor. We will definitely be back!

Best food I tell you that Buffalo burger and my Sidecar martini my Fiance and I will only pray that these owners bring this business to Los Alamitos California so we can be there regulars great job !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Absolutely delicious, highly recommended for special events as the dinner menu does run in the expensive range with rather small meal portions. They do have the best escargot smothered in an excellent pesto sauce. The clam linguini had a very creamy sauce which in my opinion goes better with a more oil base sauce. The meatloaf was very taste as well as the salmon.

Back again last night.  We frequently go to this restaurant as that good is fantastic, employees are always happy and knowledgeable, and the chef is outstanding.  One member of our party tried the scallops special with a lobster sauce which she rated as a ten out if ten. Vogue steaks were great as always and the flat bread appetizer was terrific.  Be sure to make reservations especially during winter visitor times.

My parents are big fans of Vogue Bistro, so I was really excited to try it when visiting them from Chicago for Christmas.  I checked in on Foursquare and found an offer available through Groupon - and when I went to purchase it on my phone, I found there was a Groupon now offer - $5 for $30 off.  Sweet!  We went on a weeknight and the place had a pretty good crowd.  Atmosphere is nice - cute, stylish and approachable.  The servers were great - there is one my parents usually request. She's super friendly.  I had the beet salad and it was awesome. I LOVE beets and I love them even more with goat cheese and a yummy dressing. The salad did not disappoint.  We shared the fritto misto and the beef skewer appetizers before our meal.  They were yummy, although be warned there are tempura pieces of ginger hidden in the fritto misto. It is listed on the menu, but it still caught us off guard.  I had the filet mignon. For a $24 filet, it was really good - cooked just how I liked. I'm used to filet's costing a lot more, so I was pleasantly surprised.  I will definitely be back to Vogue. If you go on a weeknight - check foursquare and groupon on your phone for deals!!  They have a frequent diner rewards card as well if you go regularly.

My husband and I finally tried this place out and where thrilled! We didn't have a reservation but were able to get a seat on a Friday night no problem. The decor is beautiful and we felt very relaxed. The waitress, Jennifer, was awesome. She was attentive without being pushy. She told us all about the specials including price which some places don't do. I had the lamb rack special and it came with three ribs, which were delicious. My husband tried the Alaskan halibut and was quite happy. We can't wait to go back and they the burgers and sweet potato fries. They looked good. If you want a nice atmosphere and yummy food try it out.

I love this neighborhood restaurant. We have so few non chain restaurants and Vogue is a nice change. Their service is slow and their prices are higher than Olive Garden but you are getting freshly made, quality food. No microwaves are used and much of the food is locally sourced and organic when possible. The French onion soup is to die for. The best I have ever had!  The lunch panini is one of my favorites. Even the filet mignon is really good. My husband loves the meatloaf and hamburgers and my kids rave over the homemade mac n cheese which they make gluten free for them. I can't say enough about their delicious martini menu. I'm so happy we have this family owned restaurant in Surprise because normally I have to go to Scottsdale for great food.

Showed up at 4:00. It was not that busy. I had the Vogue burger, it had caramelized onions, a few crumbles of blue cheese and cooked perfectly (med-rare). They serve the shoe string fries. Menu has something for everyone, I'm guessing the meatloaf and burger and other american dishes are to appease the cowboys in AZ. I didn't have to ask for drink refills, the manager stopped by the table, overall good first impression. I'll come back for some of the french offerings next time.
I've been three times and plan on going again. Simply put, it's a nice place to go and have some good food.

What a disappointment! We had reservations and were seated 20 minutes later. Our server came by apologetically with only one menu. Said they had a large group and would bring me one when available. We ordered olives and calamari for appetizers.  Olives were nothing special and the calamari was a large mound of greasy yuk, would not recommend it....kinda looked like a bloomin' onion having a bad night. My wife ordered a beet salad and a crab cake as her entree.  Finding beets in the salad was like finding pork in pork and beans.  The crab cake was the size of a large hamburger patty. Regrettably, it more filler than crab and very underwhelming. I had the skirt steak with fries. Very tasty. Were we going back (which we aren't) I would have it again. When making reservations online there was an opportunity to note a special event. I noted that we were celebrating my wife's birthday. You guessed it by now, no acknowledgment.  This restaurant has a serious management problem.

Went with a group of 7 1/2 on a Thursday night, they took us in. After a ten to fifteen min. wait. The service was good in the beginning but then the place got very busy and our server seem to forget about us because of the busyness. Another server came over and topped off our water glasses but the real clincher was went the server other than our waitress came and asked if we wanted any of the bread that was left and then proceeded to take the bread plates, then we waited over 45 min. for our food, which came separately and one entree was burnt which we had to send back. The food that we did get was good, the steaks were a little under cooked but still taste good. I ordered some vegetables but never got them. I got the feeling it's more of a bar than resturant.

The hubs and I went there on a Friday evening for dinner and this place is truly unremarkable. The menu was just okay, food was okay, and drinks were just okay...the only thing remarkable about the place was the value or lack of value for the price that was paid. Service was okay, I thought that it should have been better since we were one of 3 couples in the place, not so. I won't drive to BFE for that restaurant ever again.

Nice place.    The outdoor patio is enclosed and has a fireplace with a bunch of nice tables.  We were there on a Saturday night between 5-7pm and it was EMPTY.   The head chef is really nice and she asks for feedback on her food.  The food is AWESOME.  I had the scallop special... they were EXCELLENT.  No rubbery mess... it was soft and cooked.  The sweet potatoes were great.  I tried a friend's steak... awesome... and I tried the duck.  Even more awesome.  I truly was surprised.  Then comes the alcohol, my favorite part. hehe  I had two martinis... the De La Renta and the... oh man. I can't remember the second one.  The waitress suggested it so I never asked for it by name.   The martinis were great.  Some martinis taste way too much like vodka... these were great and fruity.  The service was awesome... very friendly.  The music... I know it's meant to be classy with the opera... it was like "Pavaratti and Friends" or something like that... it was way too loud and overwhelmed everything inside. We kept asking them to turn it down.  But otherwise, it was great.

First let me just say that it cracks me up to have such a high-end place like Vogue smack in the middle of Surprise.  It's a nice little...surprise!  A few girlfriends and I went here after a day of girly girl movie watching and it was such a nice treat to be able to sit out on Vogue's patio sipping their yummy wine.  I don't like wine, but they talked me into getting a glass of Mr. Loosen (Riesling, Germany) and it was not bad at all.  The four of us ordered the cheese plate to start with.  I'm not much of a gourmet cheese person (let's just say nacho cheese is one of my best friends).  So, I didn't quite love it as much as my friends did...but I did like the goat cheese and the pine nut Gouda.  We decided to each order two starters each so we could have a nice sampling of many dishes instead of getting entrees that we could enjoy on our own.  I highly recommend doing this!!  There is just so much on their menu that is appealing to the eye and stomach.  In all, we ordered the Vogue onion soup (which had a cheesy and super delicious flaky bread on top), beef skewers w/miso marinade, sweet potato fries w/sweet and spicy aiole sauce, mac & cheese, butternut squash w/vanilla, bruschetta (that night's version had pesto and cheese whipped together with a yellow tomato topping), and potato au gratin.  We had quite the spread in front of us.  Our waitress told us that she wanted to sit and join us!  It was a fantastic meal despite the few bites we got of each.  I was full by the time I had about 2-3 bites from each plate.    Vogue has a really relaxing atmosphere and wonderful service to boot.  Even though they were showing Ratoutille (Disney film) on the TVs, my friends tell me that many times they show fashion shows.  They have a huge list of different martinis, all named after designers.  I wish I was a martini fan so I could try them.  But the wine was wonderful treat for a night of sitting and relaxing with girlfriends.

The first word that comes to mind about my recent experience at Vogue Bistro is "DISAPPOINTED". From start to finish, our visit was simply that, disappointing. I knew things had changed there when we waited to be greeted at the hostess stand and a server came up to greet the woman in front of us. He kept trying to seat her when all she was doing was picking up a to-go order that she had already been helped with. He finally got snippy with her when he caught on that she wasn't needing his help. I don't know why he wasn't catching on...she said it loud and clear about how she was picking up a to-go order and didnt need help. So that was the kick-off to our evening.   Now in all fairness, our server was pleasant enough. She was thorough, polite, and competent. The food though was quite disappointing. The fritto misto was a hot mess. Well in this case, a cold mess. Although we were seated on the patio, you would think that in those first few seconds of being on the table, the food would be hot...not the case. It was a big, discombobulated pile of cold, fried mess. The calamari was terrible. It was chewy, overdone, and mixed in so much into the other fried items that you couldn't tell what you were eating most of the time. Every thing tasted exactly the same...flavorless.  My friend and I ordered salads and my son ordered the Vogue Steak. I ordered the Vogue Salad. Most of the time when you get a frisee salad, frisee is a featured green. In this salad it is THE green. The dressing was minimal at best and the chicken was flavorless. Very disappointing. My son ordered his steak medium and one part of the onglet was rare and the other part was well done. And there was a RIDICULOUS amount of shoestring fries. It was a serving enough for 6 people. And the food took FOREVER to come out! We watched the servers waiting anxiously for the kitchen to get the orders out and could see by the body language that they were uncomfortably antsy.   So all in all, I paid $97 for meh. That was for the Fritto Mess, Steak Vogue, 2 salads and 2 glasses of wine. And that chaps my hide. But I will tell you...there are better restaurants in Surprise that put out better food at far less of a dent in your wallet that will treat you like a valued guest. Go there. You will be far more satisfied than with my experience at Vogue.

Can't go wrong.   I've never had a bad meal here, but we'll keep trying.  See, they just can't seem to fuck up; and I think that's the part I like about them the most.   But we will stay vigilant, dear Bon Viveur.

Very good food and yummy drinks! It is my husband's and my date night. If you like martinis this is the place.  I get the Lactose, it's light and refreshing. My husband gets the Makers Side Car which has orange flavoring paired nicely with the whiskey. A definite try here is Surprise.

Second time I've been to Vogue. Nicely appointed little place. The waiting area is a little tight when there's more than three people (a la Babbo) - in our case we had a reservation for 6:30pm and about 2 minutes after we arrived a bunch of Sun City q-tips showed up, like they always do, crowding us out while we waited to be seated. While waiting I noticed that I appeared a little underdressed by comparison with the other patrons but quite frankly I didn't care. I was just in t-shirt and cargo pants. Everyone else appeared to be dressed in their Sunday finest for church. Kind of like when someone goes to a Chinese or sushi restaurant, all of a sudden they feel compelled to fumble about with chopsticks and eat at a quarter the speed they could otherwise with knife and fork. It's Surprise, for crying out loud, not Scottsdale. Anyway, we were seated and at that point I no longer felt cramped. Next up was Jonathan, the waiter, who explained all the specials for that evening. He knew them pretty well, but we felt like we needed a Mensa certification to be able to parse and remember them all - one of those times when you really had to isolate the item you wanted and lock it in mentally before he completed his encyclopediac explanation of all ten specials and their garnishings.  I got the frog legs appetizer - have not had those in YEARS. Not bad, but small as you'd imagine. Had I KNOWN it cost $13 I would have certainly gotten something else, probably the farro? For the entree, I went for the big $33 ribeye which was that night's special. DAMN was it good. My knife cut through the steak like butter. Came with those tiny fingerling potatoes and enoki mushrooms. The wife settled for the Vogue Burger because someone at her work apparently frequents this place and loves it. She, too, wasn't disappointed. She got a Vogue Martini - strong and good. We brought my toddler - he had the kid's slider with shoestring fries and enjoyed both.  I've decided that my steak was the second best I've ever had in my life. Perfectly cooked to my request too (strangely, though, Jonathan asked what "temperature" we wanted our meat - after a second's worth of blank look I was tempted to let him know that if the meat wasn't precisely 144 degrees I would send it back, but settled on specifying "medium"). Best steak I've ever had is still my first Prime Rib, but of course anywhere outside of Nebraska would be hard pressed to beat local, fresh Omaha beef. See my review of The Drover in Omaha NE for more details. This one was very close behind.  Would I go back here? Sure, for a special occasion, such as on this night. Was it worth the money? Tough call. I'd say yes, but just barely. Better value than Don and Charlie's in Scottsdale, that's for damn sure. Hopefully Surprise will wind up with more of this sort of place. They have a very good selection of food and drink on the menu and decent sized portions - none of that giant-plate-micro-meal rubbish.

Worst meal we have ever encountered. The duck looked like a dry, overcooked chicken leg. The taste was awful with the flavor of recooked, old chicken. The potato slices were hard and beyond crisp to the point of burnt.  The meatloaf had a burnt crust on it. Seemed to have been sitting in the broiler a long time. The vegetables were limp and soggy. There was nothing positive about this experience. I knew we were in trouble when the hostess asked in a nasty manner, "do you have a reservation?". The place was at best half full. Our seat was about 1 foot away from our neighbor and we could have had a 4 way conversation.  Yes, we could have gotten another meal but after waiting a long time who wants to wait for another bad meal! We will never return nor will will recommend it to anyone. The one star is for available parking.
I love this this place. Food is always great and the Meatloaf is to die for, and I am picky when it comes to meatloaf! I love bringing friends and family here when they come to visit.

The meal was fine.  We just had happy hour appetizers and they were very tasty.  The fresh oysters were superb, as were the martinis.  The reason for only 2 stars was the discrepancy in the bill.  After I signed the receipt and left a 20 percent tip, I looked at my statement the next day and the tip was for more than I signed and agreed to.  Could have been a clerical error, and I was willing to give the benefit of the doubt.  I contacted the restaurant, and was told a manager would contact me.  Needless to say, I have not been contacted.  I have filed a dispute with my card issuer as a result.  Since I have not been contacted by management, I can only assume that they may have tried to skim.
Overrated, subpar customer service and mediocre food. I didn't even want to give them one star!

Been there several times, including tonight, with bad experiences. Last time! I'm an idiot to pay top prices for such horrible attempts to prepare food after being burned the first time. Don't spend this kind of $ here, go to an expensive place that earns your money.
Beautiful design! I been here recently. Not much to choose from; speaking about food.  Coffee was pretty good

Heard about this restaurant from others so finally decided to try it. Went for a lunch and sat outside on the lovely patio. I ordered the croque madam and it was delicious. I also tried the French fries which were also good. I plan to go back for dinner sometime soon.

Had a wonderful meal here last week.  I sat at bar with friends.  They were local regulars so knew Heather who made the best martinis.  She was attentive and our dining experience was just terrific.  I had the filet mignon and my friend had the meatloaf which was made with different meats.  My meal was tasty and the potatoes were delish.  Wish I would of had more than 3 string beans for veggies, but overall it was plenty.  The bar seems to be the place to be, so I'd definately hang here with a martini and an appetizer if I'm in the area again.

My husband and I had heard wonderful things about the food at the Vogue Bistro so we finally went for dinner.  The food was so wonderful that we bought a $100 gift certificate for my mom and her husband to go and enjoy a few diners there also!  We look forward to dining there again soon :-)

Upon arriving at Vogue Bistro for a Valentine's Dinner on 2/13/15, we were told that online reservations were only given an outdoor table and there were no exceptions. Their online reservation page did not mention this at all. After complaining and threatening to leave we were given a table inside. Then, I received my Duck Confit which after two bites of pure duck fat I tried to pry the duck from the bone and was unable. It was very stringy, like it was microwaved. Truly disgusting!  Then I tried the Creme Brulee and got a huge taste of ash because the sugar layer on top had been burnt. The ambiance was anything but Romantic, very loud,  rushed, and disappointing. If I could use negative stars I would. $100 wasted, BEWARE!

I've been going here for almost 6 years. I love the fact you can go into here and get and amazing burger for 10 bucks or work your way up to the Chef's Specials. There is nothing on there menu that is bad, and I know I've had everything. French Onion soup, Escargot, and the Meatloaf is my favorite. I know what you're thinking Meatloaf... Yes it is amazing. Definitely grab some Martini's while you're here. Heather is the Bar Manager, and all of her cocktails are amazing!

We love Vogue Bistro. The service is always good, and the food is delicious. They have the best burger in town, or you can't go wrong with any of their other menu items. The ambiance is a little upscale, but still comfortable for everyone.

Bonjour Surprise!  Vogue Bistro is a French/European/American delight to visit for us west side desert dwellers. This mid to higher priced establishment offers the best cocktails we can get over here in Surprise. We have been there several times and always enjoy the delicious French and American dishes from the menu and nightly specials offered by the chef. We always feel welcome as the staff remembers our favorites each time we come in.

This is a well organized restaurant.  Everything from their incredible food menu to their talented and knowledgeable servers, this place does food and food service right! Plus they got amazing happy hour deals weekly and food specials that never disappoint. Taylor is an exceptional server and his knowledge of the food and the food ingredients for each dish on the menu are helpful when deciding on what food options to choose from.

I want to like this place, but have mixed feelings about it.  I love the fish panini--it's delicious.  Everything else on the menu that I've tasted is decent (a fish dish, butternut squash, risotto dish with grains, calamari, sweet potato fries, plantains), but I am a vegetarian plus eat seafood, and don't feel like there is much I can get there, aside from some small sides that I don't think are worth the price.  I feel like you pay more for the yuppie modern enviornment.  I had a fish entree dinner special once, but didn't find it good enough to justify the $30 price.  I don't mind paying lots of money for good food, but this place in my opinion is hip but the food is average, although there are some nice flavors (but not distinct enough to make them memorable).

After being terribly depressed by the endless chain-restaurants inundating Surprise, my girlfriend and I were excited to finally try the independent Vogue Bistro.  In short: a bit pricey, but we had an outstanding dining experience.  Although it's located in a shopping mall (like everything else here) Vogue separates itself with a pleasantly modern design and fresh decor.  It's a small restaurant, with additional outdoor seating.  We went on a weekend, and we were happy to have made a reservation.  The wine list is quite extensive and well-annotated.  And our server was very helpful in choosing a good selection.  We started off with the cheese plate as an appetizer, and it was beautifully presented with a yummy selection of cheeses and grapes.  My girlfriend is vegetarian, and although they had a couple of nice vegetarian entrees, the chef prepared a special vegetarian dish for my girlfriend including a beautiful salad along with orzo with mushrooms and spinach.  I went with the day's special Chilean sea bass with wasabi mashed potatoes and eggplant stuffed with rock shrimp.  The fish was cooked to perfection, and the tastes blended beautifully.  Even though we were stuffed, we decided to try their desserts, too.  We had a blueberry-coconut tart, and a dish of home-made chocolates.  Both were wonderful.  Although the restaurant is a bit pricey, it's definitely worth it.  There simply are very few restaurants in Surprise of the quality exhibited by Vogue.  We'll certainly be going back!

We have been to Vogue Bistro twice now and both visits have been great.  On both visits we coincidentally had Jasin as our server and he is a key ingredient to our enjoyment of Vogue.  He even remembered us on our second visit and my martini preference!  The food both times was outstanding and we highly recommend the shrimp cocktail (largest shrimp I have ever seen) or the tuna tower as appetizers, each one easily serves 2.  The salmon is fantastic as are their burgers.  We usually do not order desserts but we did have the chocolate cake which was decadent and a perfect share plate as it is so rich.  We hope to try bar seating some time which can be reserved but we also hope to have more visits with Jasin as our server!

We've been coming here for over a year. The service and food are consistently amazing! The holiday and valentine specials are always excellent and the wait staff remembers your preferences even after not visiting for 6 months & the wait staff are always the same so you know they treat their employees right. Where else does this? The Meatloaf is awesome even if you don't like meatloaf, great with one of many Belgium "abbey" style ales they serve.

Must try! The food is really good. Great Filet, my fish was mouth watering with a really great flavor combination. The Creme Brûlée is incredible, it melts in your mouth. They also have a great martini menu, so get your driver set up. I can't wait to go back.

I love this place! The food here is amazing!! The prices are very good for the quality of the food. My favorites are the chicken panini and the French onion soup.  Also they have some very tasty and unique martinis!

We really like this place.  Husband loves the meatloaf; I think the quiche is the best I've ever had anywhere.  Upscale, casual, charming, interesting and good menu.  We've liked everything we've ever had there, and try to go whenever we're in the Phoenix area.

Came here on a Tuesday evening around 6 with no reservation and was seated right away. The decor is nice and there is an extensive cocktail menu, I didn't drink but heard great things from our fellow dinners about the martinis. My friend and I both got sparkling lemonades and they were amazing. The service we received was very friendly and polite but time was definitely not of the essence.   We started with the bruschetta and French onion soup. The bruschetta was seriously so good, just an awesome combo of flavors. The French onion soup was super savory and had a lot of puff pastry and delicious cheese to help break it up.   I had the pistachio pesto pasta with chicken. I was really excited to try this and definitely not disappointed. The chicken was juicy and well cooked. The pasta though was absolutely delicious! And the pistachio pesto sauce was amazing, just like a hint of nutty warmth to it. So so good!   We shared the creme brûlée for dessert and it was fantastic. Perfect temp all around.   I think that this is definitely a west valley gem and would recommend it to anyone in the area.

Visited Vogue tonight.  Our second time there.   The place was busy. (Thursday)  Had a good table and our server, Shawn, was very engaging and friendly.  However, he had way too many tables assigned to him.   Service was somewhat slow.  He quoted a price on the house wine $10 too low and then was 'disappointed' we called him on it.  We still gave him the 20% tip because he was working hard.  The double order of raw oysters were very good, but oddly no soda crackers were available.   The Meatloaf was mushy.  Asparagus was the thick, heavy stalk variety.  Quite tough.  The au gratin potatoes were 10 degrees above room temp.  The Hangers Beef Steak had very little flavor.  Oysters, A martini, a glass of house pino noir and a bottle of same, two entrees, no desert.  My bill totaled $181.00   All four in our group decided our meals were OKAY....  but not worth a another visit.

Vogue Bistro is a great place for a beautiful dinner!  I went here to celebrate my birthday and my dads birthday.  It was unique in a location where finding high quality upscale dining at a reasonable price is difficult. Must haves: brussel sprouts, stuffed mushrooms and caprese salad. I also really enjoyed the dry creek Zinfandel!!  Service was excellent - more of a slow dining experience but the staff was very knowledgable!
We particularly enjoyed the Beet Salad and the Spinach! The panini was so-so because the bread was not squashed in the panini grill the way it should have been.

So we walked in around 5pm and the place was dead. We had a reservation and overheard the waitress tell someone they only take reservations on the weekend no walk ins. So this has me pumped must be really good. We sat down and ordered the stuff mushrooms for $9 the waiter said do I want two or 4 well the $9 price is for only two. I ordered 4 should have stuck with 2. Didn't really taste the crab that much. I orders the nightly special 22 ounce steak $35 and my wife got salmon. 55 minutes later we finally get our food. During our wait the waiter did not check up on us and we noticed other people getting bread. We finally asked for some bread which was very good.  So on the the main meal. Steak came out look awesome but i can say that's the most tasteless steak I have ever eaten in my life.  Bland bite after bland bite.  It was funny the guy next to us said the same exact thing. My wife's Salmon was nothing special.  Again the waiter did nothing to check in see how my steak was cooked or would you like some flavor for your steak.  The veggies that came with it were amazing, next time I am going to order the steak hold the steak and double up on the veggies.  Total bill came out to just short of $100. Wrap things up, bad service l, long food wait times, bland steak, killer veggies.

Last night was my first time at Vogue Bistro.  What a really bad experience.   The night started with the hostess arguing with me about a seat selection.  It took about 30 mins to order a drink from the bar and about 2 hours to get our dinner.  The waitress completely disappeared.   Seriously, she was gone and no where to be found. Not once did anyone check on us or apologized for the delay in service.  I was completely embarrassed to being my friends to Vogue Bistro.  The staff was extremely rude and service was horrible.  Will never go back!  Thank Vogue Bistro for worst dining experience ever!!!!

This little restaurant with a big patio serves of an assortment of dishes that are made with French Taught Techniques. Chef Aurore has trained in France.   We placed our order and waited around a half hour for our lunches. I do have to give our waiter credit for spotting that my husband's request to omit the aioli for his sandwich was ignored by the cook. The waiter gives my husband the choice of eating it anyway or getting a new one made with his request of no aioli. My husband wanted a new one so we waited maybe another half hour while my salad is sitting in the window all this time getting warm and wilted.  Our plates arrive and as warm and slightly wilted as my salad is the salad was masterfully made and very layered with flavors. The creamy shallot vinaigrette was so delicious I could drink it and I never tasted walnuts that were so complex before. I also need to add that the house smoked salmon might have been the most delicious buttery fresh salmon I've ever had anywhere. However the house baked bread that came with it came out and seemed stale and not so tasty.   Unfortunately the cooks that were on don't take to re-fires very well and inflicted something on the pork in my husband's sandwich. The pork was very dry and was drier than dog food jerky. The pork suffered something like rigor mortis it was deader than dead.  Our waiter seemed busy and didn't ask how our meals were but offered us a complimentary dessert because of the aioli mess up and how long we waited for everything. (he didn't even know about the pork)  I picked the house made chocolate collection. It was an assortment of chocolates that were obviously very high quality. They were extremely good.  This should have been a five star review but lunch shouldn't take two hours, meal request should be honored and I have nothing more to say about the pork as I said enough. I do note I didn't see Chef Aurore in the building.   Also the 4 star rating seems high after everything mentioned but some of the food was so masterfully done I can't give a lower than 4 star rating and chalk this up to them having a bad day.  PHENOMENAL and ABOMINABLE

I've been here twice-once for lunch and once for dinner. I was pleased both times. Service was good and the food was excellent! The calamari appetizer is wonderful!! Killer martinis too! I'll definitely be back again!

Patron beware everything here is cooked with wine.  last time we were there,I felt like we just got raped after we got the check lol. I felt the quality of the food did not equate to the prices they charge here....just because it's a French restaurant does not justify over pricing unless the food is just so special it equals the price..however that is not the case here.

I have been to Vogue on several different occasions each and every time attempting to find a reason to love it.  I have never been truly successful.   I decided to give it just one more try for lunch.  I decided not to try an entree and stick to a side or appetizer.  I'm glad that I did.  I had the mac and cheese and will probably make another trip for that side dish alone.   My husband had the Vogue burger and he shared with me.  I loved the toppings, but the patty itself lacked seasoning.   Perhaps this isn't fair, but I have had too many unsatisfactory dishes there in the past that I find it hard to give Vogue more than 3 stars right now.  I would probably say my 3 stars would actually be 3.5 stars if it was possible.  If I go back and have another good dish, I will be updating my review!

What a pleasant surprise in Surprise! We were so lucky to have used Yelp to find a place close to our hotel. Yes, a French bistro west of Phoenix!  We came to Surprise for baseball and a birthday and added a bistro! Perfect! We paid attention to Yelp's recommendation to make a reservation and they use Open Table!  They have a wonderful bar and are known for their martinis. Also you can sit outside. We chose to stay inside as it was windy. The wine list is adequate and we chose the Veuve Clicquot champagne (our favorite for 30 years).  Our waiter, Sean, is very funny, personable and professional! Ask for him when you come in!  A very nice bistro menu with some nice specials. We chose to share the ubiquitous escargots, which was simply prepared and so tasty. I chose the special of Dover Sole stuffed with scallops, crab, and shrimp on a bed of house made angel hair with a rich lobster sauce. My wife chose the home made pasta with a green chili sauce that was perfect!  The dessert menu was so wonderful to peruse with standouts of "The Cake" and bread pudding, but alas we were stuffed and didn't want to overdo it. Next time!!  Again, thank you, Sean, for making us laugh and feel so welcome! As a California governor once said, "I'll be back!"

Stopped by for a late lunch - escargot appetizer, croque monsieur sandwich, bread pudding, cappuccino.  Very nice atmosphere, good/friendly service, good food presentation, reasonable prices - except....  the food was incredibly bland:  Escargot had no garlic (and at $15, way overpriced given the lack of taste), sandwich was tasteless.  Bread pudding was pretty good, so was the cappuccino (but note to staff:  in a fancyish restaurant, it should really be served with a demitasse spoon for the foam).    They have some nice looking burgers on the menu - and the place might be nice for a burger and beer in a pleasant setting.  I won't be going back for a fancy meal, and certainly not at the dinnertime prices.

Great service, however it is definitely over priced!! The food is nothing out of this world and the portions are very small. The location is not easy to find as it is hidden in a corner behind a Basha's supermarket. I don't think I will be returning anytime soon.
Probably the most upscale restaurant in Surprise.  Quality food and one of the few places to eat for those that choose a clean diet. Always great service.
Disappointed. Tried diner entree vs burgers (which are Good) Small portions, over-priced, bad table .....even had 1 dinner free and still feel like I  got  ripped off

So glad we finally tried Vogue Bistro!  Our server, Dana was the best!  She was so personable and knowledgeable of the menu!  She answered all our questions & made great suggestions.  We started with the oysters Rockefeller & the French onion soup -- both amazing!  We had duck two ways and the steak Vogue as our entrees -- again, both amazing!! Great drink menu too!  Can't wait to go back...we already know what we're going to order!

We had an amazing dinner here tonight!!  Our server was extremely knowledgeable and attentive. I had the shrimp and grits special ad a well as the lobster bisque. Absolutely delicious!!  Our martinis were perfection!!  We will return
We were surprised to find this gem in a strip mall in Surprise, Arizona. Great food and super attentive, friendly service. Highly recommended if you're in the area!

We decided to try to give this place a shot, there were so many good reviews.  We got to the restaurant right when it opened on a Friday afternoon.  When we walked in we were asked if we had reservations...what!?...reservations at 4 p.m. on a Friday afternoon?  I told the host no and asked if this was a problem, he stated "well it makes it easier"...what!?..I looked around and their were exactly three people in the restaurant.  The entire place was empty inside and out.  He then looked really put out as he got the menus.  He then made a show of looking around for a table...in an empty restaurant.    At that point we told him never mind that it seemed as though we were causing him a hassle and we left.  On a side note we went down the street to Rito's and had an amazing green chili burro.

Such a basic restaurant that pretends to be better than it is. It was my sisters 17th birthday tonight (no idea why she picked this place) but I was looking forward to it anyway. We show up only to find its CLOSED, ALTHOUGH we had a reservation booked for 10 people!!! They didn't even have the respect to give us a call. This lack of service is typically reserved for Applebees or Chilis, I will never be taking my family here again.

Went for Easter brunch. I understand this was the first time they did brunch. I was very disappointed. The portions were a joke. I was with a party of 8 and we all left hungry. My crepes were cold. 3 of the meals were served missing the side of potatoes. The drink prices were crazy expensive. We left there feeling taken advantage of.  Won't go back.

I've been to this restaurant twice so far, once for my birthday with my coworkers back in December 2011 and in January 2012, I returned so I could let my husband try their food. I'll admit that I recognized the restaurant when flipping through Phoenix magazine, and I thought, "Finally, a nicer bistro type restaurant on the west side of the valley!" When I came with my coworkers in December, we came during lunch hour and we called ahead so that they could save a table for 6-7 of us. The restaurant was set up with a more modern take on a bistro. The booths are black and there are chandeliers hanging from the ceiling with trendy wallpaper. The atmosphere is lively and there's a flat panel tv behind the bar in case you want to catch the game (for the husbands who are dragged there by their wives). The crowd is mixed. There are some young couples, some business men on their lunch break, and women enjoying some time with their friends away from home and sipping wine together.  You need to come prepared to spend at least a little over an hour there and it says this right on the menu. Most of their entrees take alot of time and preparation. All we could think was, "This better be worth it," and thankfully it was! The Vogue mac and cheese has truffles and pancetta and it just makes it so rich and flavorful! Surprisingly, we also shared the plantains which didn't really make sense to me on the menu since it was not the same "type" of food you'd think would be there, but they were yummy regardless. The Vogue burger is huge, so one of my friends and I split one. It was also very, very good! The waitress was so nice! Since it was my birthday, she gave our table free sweet potato fries with the maple dressing and she also gave me box with a sampling of a variety of homemade chocolates and fudge. The service and the food definitely won me over! That's why I had to drag my husband back there a month later! My husband and I came for dinner. This time we sat outside on the patio. Since it was January, it was still cooler outside, but they had heaters outside above to keep people comfortable. The restaurant is definitely capable of fitting bigger groups out on the patio. This time I enjoyed the duck confit while my husband tried the rabbit civet. He loved his dish! The rabbit did not taste too gamey. The stew had alot of flavors that complimented one another so the meat was just right and not overpowering. My duck's flavoring was very good, but some parts of the meat were on the drier side. For dessert, I had the pinapple tatin. It's basically their take on a pineapple upside down cake. It was pretty good and on the extra sweet side.  This is not someplace I'd go all the time, since it can be on the more expensive side, especially at dinner, but I will definitely return again though, because I enjoy how different it is from the usual fare that you find in Surprise.
Nice atmosphere and the food was great. Service was less than desirable though and food is priced on the higher end. Overall a good place to go for a trendy vibe in Surprise.

I decided I wanted to throw a surprise party for my mother in law and was interested in renting out the patio. I went in to ask questions and the girl at the front told me only the GM could answer my questions and she works from home most days and the best way to reach her would be via email. She handed me her card and I left. I emailed the GM that day and never heard back for 8 days. I tried calling later and same spiel - she only works Saturdays & Sunday's but mostly from home so you'd have to email. At this point I decided to call around and find another place (I was extremely disappointed that it wouldn't work at Vogue and the lack of response).   The GM got back to me, but after 10 days. I told her thanks but I found another location.   I am not sure if they food is good but if I were the GM, I would respond faster than 10 days.

We went to Vogue with friends from Surprise, AZ. Our friends have dined here before and have never been disappointed. Our group consisted of nine people. Upon arrival our table was ready and we were seated promptly. Shortly after arrival all tables were occupied, inside and on the patio.  The decor is modern and the ambiance high energy but conversation friendly. Our server was friendly and professional. One of the specials was Halibut Cheeks and Razor Clams. Four people ordered it and the Halibut Cheeks were excellent. However the Razor Clams were chewy. If the Halibut Cheeks were served without the Razor Clams I would award 5 stars.

After reading the reviews I was expecting more. The service was just OK. When I called to make a reservation I told them it was a special occasion - a birthday. They didn't bring a cupcake or make any attempt to make the meal special. No mention of anything.   When we arrived, they said our table was ready. It was a 2 top in the middle of a bench type of set up and the restaurant was empty with only one other table occupied. We requested the table at the end of the bench but I still was not happy with that option. My fault for not speaking up better. If you are not a regular I'd say expect to inferior seating.   The sides were inexpensive but they wanted $29.95 for the sea bass. That's higher than a 5 star restaurant in LA. I opted for the salmon which was about $10 less and just ok. It looked like what I get from Trader Joe's.   Next time I'm driving to Scottsdale for a more fine dining experience.

Came here once for a girls night happy hour.  The two stars is solely for the sangria.  It was delightful. Unfortunately it was also the only good thing about our visit.  The bartender was beyond was rude.  There was one other customer in the restaurant.  We waited 10 minutes to be acknowledged.  Even then it was a "hey, I'm backed up but I'll be right with you".  Really?? There is no one else here! He came back 10 minutes after that and said "so are you going to order something?" Like he was really annoyed.  We ordered a round of sangria. Ten minutes later he was back. He slammed our drinks on the table and said "is that it?  Food or are you just drinking your dinner?".  The drinks were good, but not good enough to put up with his attitude.  And 12 bucks a drink?  No thanks.  It's a shame, I had heard such wonderful things about this place.

Went here for a graduation party. The atmostphere is great, the outdoor area is perfect provided the weather is good. There's even a fireplace. I ordered the filet mignon and it was delicious. The entire plate was not very filling considering the price you pay but it does limit your food intake if you want to lose that belly. Excellent wine selection too.
I love this place. Amazing food from scratch and the service is always top notch.
You wouldn't expect to find such a delight tucked in a back corner of a shopping center. They do a real nice job. We treated family when we were in town and they couldn't say enough good things.
Amazing food and wonderful staff! It is priced a little high but the quality of the food is amazing great for date nights

In town for the holidays to visit family.Decided to stay local, they happen to run out of half the menu two days before Christmas. The waitress was very nice. The biggest shocker of the night was this old man next to us sharing his dinner with his toy Yorkie, off the table. I didn't know that dogs could vogue with their owners at dinner. The over all experience was,"o.k.". Better luck next time, and I'm bringing my dog!!
Great food, relaxing atmosphere and the staff is great. Little pricey but worth every penny.

The atmosphere here was great, but the hostess was pretty irritated with us that we didn't have a reservation (funny because the place was empty). She seated us in the very back corner on what would be the patio in better weather. They had a tarp surrounding it with heat lamps above and cold air coming in from the sides right on our table - I think that was our punishment for the lack of reservations.   As for the food, the appetizer of calamari had few squid. You had to dig for them amongst a tower of fried carrots. But everyone liked the carrots. The steak I ordered was HORRIBLE. It tasted like roast beef, maybe being baked in the oven first and the salmon was overcooked. The salad was amazing, though and so was the lasagna, but don't expect your normal Italian lasagna - not happening here. It's different, but good. The winner of the night was, surprisingly, the giant burger which my boyfriend claimed was the best he had ever eaten. The dessert of chocolate cake, almost like a torte, melted in your mouth - I'd come back for that!   I would go again if someone else was paying or if I were just going for drinks and dessert. I don't know if I'd take the chance ordering entrees again.

This small Surprise gem is surely different from everything else, it's got a head Chef.  One who actually designs and cooks what's on the menu.  The menu is fairly simple which is a good thing and almost seasonal as far as the additional dishes go (besides the specials which are always seasonal).    The mood in there is hit or miss, at times it has really good ambient music, other times it has a game on...  Going there on a week night is totally different from the weekend.  It is a small place but the patio has as many seats as inside.  There is no place to wait so if you're going on a weekend, get reservations straightened out!  So the food...  The kicthen is open, you can see the cooks working the grill and the cold food station, the Chef? Looks like she's busy with the specials, saucing, stacking, perfecting.  The specials are always carried out with care it seems, there's nothing  that gets on the plate that shouldn't be.  The specials are always worth the trip there.  The Vogue Burger, easily a "signature burger" if there is such a thing, is awesome, Gorgonzola, bacon, greens and a sauce that contains cognac! Big enough to stuff the biggest of mouths.  The flavor is big, do yourselves a favor and order this bad boy Medium Rare and wash it down with a good beer, one of the many offered.  Anything with a sauce there is good, the sweet potatoes come with a chestnut sauce, there's also a nice variation of  Aiolis there, Basil, Saffron and Chesnut... Good stuff you don't find everywhere.  Just ask for them on the side!  If you would like some great food, show up during the week for dinner, lunch is so so...  and the weekend, it doesn't seem like the cooks can keep up with the pace of a busy restaurant that deserves to stay booked to the brim.  Remember, anything the chef touches here is simply very good, get the specials.

We've been here several times, and every time it has been worth the drive out to Surprise. We finally ordered something other than the Fritto Misto and the Vogue burger. Those are our favorites and are enough for hubby and I to split. Both are, of course, excellent. The burger is always cooked perfectly (medium rare for us), and the fritto misto is unique and enough for at least 4 people to share.  Now I can happily report that the bruscetta and the salmon appetizer were also great. They're both unique twists on old favorites. The bruschetta featured creamed artichoke hearts with sliced tomato and greenery. Only downfall was that it was only 2 pieces of bread, so plan accordingly if you are going to have to share. Portions are generous but not overwhelming, and the prices are a little on the high side, but worth it. One of these days I'll get to try the macaroni and cheese with pancetta and truffles. Oh, and dessert.
This restaurant is overpriced and the food is mediocre.  I am surprised they have been in busineess as long as they have. The General Manger Jennifer, was extremely rude as well as the staff.

This little French restaurant is SO GOOD! Took family here on Christmas Eve and the service and food were superior. We were there for lunch and I had the vegetarian sandwich...For a sandwich, it was amazing! They use a delicious aioli sauce on it, and the bread was great too. Ordered a side of the sweet potato fries which came with an amazing array of dipping sauces...I can't wait to bring more people back here and to also try the breakfast and dinner offerings. Also enjoyed the ambiance. Really nice and refreshing to see something unique and upscale in the West Valley. Well done, Vogue Bistro!

Amazing food, great variety of cocktails, super service Casual relaxing atmosphere. Owner was wonderful His wife a fantastic cook, my server Sean was Fabulous and whoever my bartender was she was Fantastic. Id open on of their Vogue Bistro in So Cal it would Be wonderful to have one by the beach
The duck and farro were very tasty. The French onion soup was amazing. Had the vogue burger once before and it was one of the best burgers I have ever had.

A rare gem in a sea of chain food restaurants. I love eating here. The menu is refreshing and delicious. The specials have never let me down.  It is a little pricey but you get what you pay for in my opinion.

Visiting family in Surprise and was delighted by this wonderfully delicious eatery! Great wine list, great cocktails and the food surpassed it all. Service was excellent. This was second time there and usually a repeat visit never meets high expectations but Vogue truly did!

The service was great and the food tasted good.  My husband and I had salads and both of us spent the night in the bathroom, so don't order a salad!!!!   The others in our party had entrees and they were fine.  I'm disappointed it wasn't better.
